Film Synopsis
The narrator suggests that we watch television doing some of the
things it can do, bringing some of the things it can bring to the class¬
room, while you (the viewer) considerwhich, among these, would make
the greatest contribution toward solving your problems, toward helping
you, your classroom, or your school system move closer to your goals .
The major part of the material on screen in this film is made up of
illustrative excerpts from television lessons or special materials, based
on instructional resources of outstanding quality which have been used
in the schools. The narrator discusses briefly, as the film progresses,
what each excerpt i I lustrates, with reference, where appropriate, to the
nature of the problem involved or the need fulfilled. These excerpts
demonstrate the technicaI advantages of the medium which add impact,
focus, and clarity to any presentation, in addition to television“s capac¬
ity for bringing unusua I or inaccessible materials into the c lassroom with
a minimum of difficulty or delay. Reference is made also to some of the
special learning opportunities which television can offer to special
groups .
